comments.body: The leaves look ugly. simply hueing the birch leaves to pink gives a nicer look. the flowers should be no more than 5 pixels
Regarding cherry blossoms: Would it be possible to implement both white and pink leaf blocks? Many prominent cherry trees and groves have white blooms in spring as well as pink.

I think this might be a little bit unnecessary to Minecrafts progression. Iron is already the second strongest armor in the game and I think it would be a little redundant to make a tier of armor that is between iron and diamond. (Netherite is its own armor set but its an upgrade to diamond)

And you could make steel armor and it would be
Stronger than iron armor and tools that have
More durability then iron tools but still be as fast as iron tools
Instead you could make steel by combining coal and iron, and you could use it to craft chainmail
I do believe this should be added to Bedrock but I do think thst a reason they'll say no is because there is already a mod for this in Bedrock.
I like that idea too!! Show Coordinates & Days option in 1.20 is good idea

sadly the days feature on multiplayer servers has been removed from vanilla java. This could be them trying to phase out this feature from the game completely or just a bug that has gone unnoticed. - Removed in 1.20.2
why did they remove the day count now i have to download mods to see m day count
Gross
Too narrow specialization. It is worth adding additional functionality, for example, chopping off limbs from mobs right during the battle (with an impact on their behavior).
But the enchantment would make charged creepers useless outside of pvp. And, this enchantment would make whiter skeleton farms way too overpowered.
Good point about charged creeper functionality. I could imagine charged gunpowder being added and a stronger tier of TNT crafted with it.
^Man, devs should just nerf the imbalanced farms.

“Alongside the enchantment, most mobs, passive and hostile alike, could drop their head at a LOW chance…” (emphasis added). So wither skeleton farms wouldn’t really be boosted. Anyway, they may not need to have this enchantment boost wither skeleton drops.
Marshes should generate as a sub-biome for swamps and mangroves, but they should also generate in shallow beaches with tons of flat shore.
I agree to this idea. I am already adding it to my upcoming Bedrock server Origincraft.
1.20 is about self expression and storytelling. This is interesting, but we should save this villager variant for another update.

Would be rather nice, but then bamboo forests builds (which fit the block most) would be impossible without constant repair. I'd only allow them to eat slabs, stairs and fencing, and would make it so that waxing them with honeycomb renders them unappetizing.
The idea of a panda eating my house seems good. Pandas need to stand up for themselves.
No
They should only eat the wood in item form, though! If they ate the actual placed block, structures would be eaten up.
RELEASE THE PANDAS
ww wh- w- wha what?!

I'm no panda expert, but I'm going to assume Pandas only really eat the bamboo shoots/stalks when they're alive (you know, actually green) and full of nutrients. They probably wouldn't actually eat dried out bamboo wood.
cool reference but I doubt mojang would ever add it

I've been sitting on this idea for a while now and I think the idea of custom music discs would unfortunately render noteblock contraptions obsolete.

I understand that in my original suggestion that I suggested that noteblock contraptions would be used to program the sound file into the music disc but that would not only make music discs less special but as I've said before make noteblock contraptions only used to program the player-made discs.
(Not very innovative if you ask me.)

What I was hoping to get out of custom music discs was to allow players to easily create their own music but I see now that I should be instead looking in a new direction.

I'll write again soon,
- Marbles9342
teniendo en cuenta que el hacha también se utiliza para el combate eso no tiene mucho sentido
Maybe they only keep the items if they’re destroyed by a silk touch pick?

Maybe they only keep the items if they’re destroyed by a silk touch pick?

If so, I think pots won't drop themselves when not applied with silk touch. (I just can't imagine you will get a full pot with a silk touch pick but an empty one otherwise)
Not so sure about the ability of pots to retain their items, but they should absolutely be dispensable!
or actual add nice pots for decor and can be used like storage or some little boxes with keys like a little chests
No
okay, i thought you just wanted it to be one type which wouldn't be a great idea,
why? it lost. there are a lot of mobs people really liked that lost the mob votes. it would be entirely unfair to people who voted for previous losing mobs just to put the one you liked in the game

Agreed. The majority of minecraft players are seasoned players. I suspect the sniffer's success in the vote was due to its popularity with these seasoned players who aren't so concerned with "loot" (since they already know how to get it, or already have it), but want a new challenge, even if the end goal is simply decorative plant life.

There are still newer players coming to Minecraft all the time, for whom everything is new, and finding a sniffer egg is far too challenging, with low reward. Adversely, getting loot from a rascal is extremely rewarding and helpful, and the possibility of a rascal popping up to deliver that would be great help in encouraging them to continue playing when the going gets tough.

I know a vote is democratic, but these mobs are providing different needs to different player demographics, leaving newer players a little out in the cold. Why not both mobs?
I see you we go and I follow

Unfortunately, it lost. I feel like if we knew the sniffer would give us two useless flowers, it would have though. I know I would have voted for the rascal, but I thought the sniffer would give a bunch of plants with different uses.

As the person above said, it would be unfair for older mob votes too. 

I wish they would give us more details on mobs during the voting. Either that, or they should give us a vote using losing mobs as they've promised before.
They should. Not only for the loot. But also cause they would be considered cave villagers. Just like how the piglins are nether villagers. I’ve always wanted cave dwelling creatures in the game.
They should. Not only for the loot. But also cause they would be considered cave villagers. Just like how the piglins are nether villagers. I’ve always wanted cave dwelling creatures in the game.

As a Sniffer voter I would likewise see the Rascal added to the game. It was a cool concept to add a new mob specifically underground. Hide and seek sounded like a fun mechanic at least. The only suggestion / improvement I would make is for it to give an enchanted diamond pickaxe; Iron is fine, but once you get diamond I feel like players wouldn't be incentivized to play with the Rascal. An alternative would be for the Rascal to provide special pickaxes, perhaps fortune 5 or some new / unique tool (mining) enchantments?
This would be cool but think, what would that suspicious block be? I mean there is no sand or gravel like substance that some archaeological items could be hiding in.
Maybe there can be special trims to come along with it. Or some kind of egg that could hatch an ender creature?
No point, and are likely intentionally exclusive to Legends.

Yes! Nice idea! They really should do that. It wouldn't be EASY to get the trims, so it would still make the  gold armor feature useful, at least until you have access to the trims you want.
